===Requirements===
* [[Adventure Rank]] 30 or above
* Complete the "[[Ritou Escape Plan]]" part of the [[Archon Quest]] [[Chapter II]]: Act I - [[The Immovable God and the Eternal Euthymia]].
* For a better experience, complete [[Arataki Itto]]'s [[Story Quest]] [[Taurus Iracundus Chapter]]: Act I - [[Rise Up, Golden Soul]].
** If the player has not completed Arataki Itto's Story Quest Taurus Iracundus Chapter: Act I - "Rise Up, Golden Soul," they can enter the event through "Quick Start" in the event page.

===Summary===
* During the event, take part in Akitsu Kimodameshi, complete [[Akitsu Kimodameshi/Leisurely Pastime|Leisurely Pastime]] and [[Akitsu Kimodameshi/Shatterdark|Shatterdark]] challenges to obtain rewards such as [[Primogem]]s, [[Crown of Insight]], the event-exclusive weapon "[[Toukabou Shigure]] (Sword)" and its [[Parasol Talcum|refinement material]] as well as the Furnishing "[[Kimodameshi Vivaciousness]]."
* Two new Leisurely Pastime and one new Shatterdark challenges will be available upon the first, third, and fifth days of the event. Players will have to complete all challenges under Playful Leisure difficulty in the corresponding stages of Leisurely Pastime to unlock the corresponding Shatterdark challenge.
* Complete designated challenges in Leisurely Pastime and Shatterdark to claim Primogems, the event-exclusive weapon Toukabou Shigure (Sword), [[Courage Test Ticket]]s, [[Hero's Wit]], [[Mystic Enhancement Ore]], and [[Mora]]. Courage Test Tickets can be used to exchange for rewards such as Parasol Talcum, Crown of Insight, [[Weapon Ascension Material]]s, and [[Talent Level-Up Material]]s from the Event Shop.
* Complete the "Akitsu Kimodameshi" quest chain to obtain rewards such as Primogems, the Furnishing "Kimodameshi Vivaciousness," and Hero's Wit.
* After the event gameplay period ends, Courage Test Tickets will disappear. Please make sure to claim the rewards in time.

===Tutorial===
;Akitsu Yuugei{{Colon}} Rules
{{Tutorial
|image1  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Rules 1.png
|text1   = While playing Akitsu Yuugei, the player must {{Color|help|actively serve their ball}}, and propel the Skill-Ball forward using the bar.<br />The Skill-Ball will rebound upon colliding with the bar. If the collision occurs {{Color|help|while the bar is moving}}, the {{Color|help|rebound vector}} of the ball will also change.
|image2  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Rules 2.png
|text2   = Before embarking on a challenge, players can select {{Color|help|Modifiers}} in the pre-match menu to gain more effective bonuses. Certain Modifiers must be unlocked after completing specific stages, and some Modifiers can even be enhanced by completing Shatterdark stages.
|image3  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Rules 3.png
|text3   = Based on the {{Color|help|Elemental Type}} possessed by the character controlling the bar, the bar will be infused with the corresponding element and {{Color|help|apply the same element}} to the Skill-Ball.<br />During Akitsu Yuugei, when there are {{Color|help|Pyro, Hydro, Cryo, or Electro}} Characters on the field, they will apply their corresponding element to the bar.
|image4  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Rules 4.png
|text4   = When there are less than a requisite amount of bricks on the field, and the ball lands another hit, the bar will {{Color|help|fire a flurry of fireworks forward}}. Should any of these fireworks hit a brick, they will inflict DMG. You can use this method to destroy bricks that are hard to hit.
|image5  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Rules 5.png
|text5   = While playing Leisurely Pastime for Akitsu Yuugei, you can join Co-Op mode as a single player. If already in Co-Op mode, you can invite a player from your party to play together.<br />Shatterdark mode can only be played solo.
}}

;Akitsu Yuugei{{Colon}} Scoring and Combos
{{Tutorial
|image1  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Scoring 1.png
|text1   = Use Skill-Balls to deal DMG to bricks and thereby {{Color|help|score points}}. The more {{Color|help|time there is remaining}} when the challenge ends, and the higher the {{Color|help|Combo count}} you achieve, the more {{Color|help|additional points}} you will score.
|image2  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Scoring 2.png
|text2   = Scoring consecutive hits on bricks to deal DMG will rack up your {{Color|help|Combo count}}. This Combo count will {{Color|help|reset}} once you lose the {{Color|help|final}} Skill-Ball you have on the field.
}}

}}

;Akitsu Yuugei{{Colon}} Surgeball
{{Tutorial

;Akitsu Yuugei{{Colon}} Freezeball
{{Tutorial

{{Tutorial

{{Tutorial

{{Tutorial
|image1  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Gibbering Grumbler 1.png

{{Tutorial

;Mesmeric Marine Maiden
{{Tutorial
|image1  = Tutorial Akitsu Yuugei Mesmeric Marine Maiden 1.png

These summoned bricks will disappear if you {{Color|help|shoot the Skill-Ball through mirrors enough times}} or if you wait for a set period.
